articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia attacked Ukrainian energy facilities in three regions on Saturday, damaging equipment and injuring at least one energy worker, Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said.
articles.title: Russia hits Ukrainian energy facilities in three regions, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas and several international officials will be in Riyadh this week for talks aimed at pushing for a peace agreement in Gaza to be held on the sidelines of a World Economic Forum meeting, the WEF's president said on Saturday.
articles.title: Abbas, international leaders to hold Gaza talks in Riyadh this week

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon has moved towards accepting the International Criminal Court's jurisdiction to prosecute violations on Lebanese territory since October, in what Human Rights Watch said on Saturday was a "landmark step" towards justice for war crimes.
articles.title: Lebanon moves towards accepting ICC jurisdiction for war crimes on its soil

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. intelligence agencies have determined that Russian President Vladimir Putin probably didn't order opposition politician Alexei Navalny killed at an Arctic prison camp in February, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday.
articles.title: US intelligence believes Putin probably didn't order Navalny to be killed, Wall Street Journal reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has sent more troops to Ocheretyne in eastern Ukraine to reinforce an offensive there, but Kyiv's forces largely hold the village and expect U.S. arms deliveries to turn the tide in their favour, the Ukrainian military said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russia steps up offensive on east Ukraine village, Kyiv says its forces holding out

articles.author: Elena Rodriguez
articles.description: Thousands of Socialist Party supporters travelled from across Spain for a rally in Madrid on Saturday to call on Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez to stay on, after he stunned the country this week by saying he might quit the premiership.
articles.title: Socialist supporters call on Spanish prime minister to stay

articles.author: Andreas Rinke
articles.description: French President Emmanuel Macron will visit Germany in May and will spend more days than planned with Chancellor Olaf Scholz, government sources said, in a sign of their ambition to bring more unity to EU relations.
articles.title: Macron visit to Germany in May to focus on EU ties

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said for the first time on Saturday that he supports a reform of the country's constitutionally-enshrined debt brake, but does not currently see any possibility of doing it right now.
articles.title: German chancellor shows support for debt brake reform in the future

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is gathering information on products of Indian spice makers MDH and Everest after Hong Kong halted sales of some of their products for allegedly containing high levels of a cancer-causing pesticide.
articles.title: US food regulator gathering information on Indian spices after alleged contamination

articles.author: Pulcherie Adjoha
articles.description: Police in Benin fired tear gas to break up a protest over the cost of living called by trade unions and they arrested several senior union figures on Saturday, witnesses and union officials said.
articles.title: Police fire tear gas to disperse Benin wage protest
